title: F75: Decompose-by-data vs decompose-by-method across all task types
hypothesis: K_avg < 1 = data-parallel wins universally (all task types). K_avg >= 1.5 = method wins for sequential/refactoring.
methodology: Monte Carlo simulation (n=100 nodes, 1000 reps each). Data decomposition: 4 batches; cost = base + cross-batch dependencies. Method decomposition: connected components; cost = base + 0.5/component mapping overhead.
key_finding: K_avg threshold (< 1.0 = data wins, >= 1.5 = method wins for high-coupling tasks) holds across all 3 task types. Swarm K_avg=0.77 (from S305 F9-NK) confirms data-parallel wins for ALL current swarm task types.
f75_status: PARTIAL→RESOLVED (sequential + refactoring tested; K_avg threshold universally confirmed)
iso_links: ISO-12 (bottleneck law — decomposition is the min-cut)
